instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
MBP A1502

No image on screen, BUT with external monitor its working 100% fine

SINCE I do not have same MBP A1502 screen to test and check if its BAD screen. Is there any other test that I could make?

Can I test an old A1278 screen on this model to check?

Any other method to test before going to buy a new screen without 100% being SURE?

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
A1278 models use LVDS screens, and A1502 eDP instead.
More than that, 2015 model is unique; not compatible with previous A1502 variants.
Not sure what board do you have there; is a must post in the title.

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
Hi

Its a 820-4924-A

Tested with a new screen and same behavior!

BTW the camera work fine!! 

Looks like its something bad on the board!

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
"Tested with a new screen"
2015 LCD assembly for sure?
It is not compatible with previous A1502 from 2013/14.

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
Yes

I bought a brand new A1502 2015 assembly display!

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message: I can record a video if you want!

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
New doesn't mean known good.
With original screen missing image and backlight at same time?

Do you get 3V at pin 5/J8300?
Also check for 5V at pins 28-30, at least in the first seconds (when chimes).
LCD_HPD_CONN should go high at same time; if LCD is connected and correctly recognized.

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
Just noticed with the new screen that is a backlight problem.

Where should I look for?

Weird that with the original screen I didnt get a backlight problem

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
As I said, you must be sure this screen is for 2015.
Or you never get backlight.
Find another KNOWN GOOD 2015 screen for test.

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
I bought described as 2015 BRAND NEW... I am not sure if its KNOWN GOOD cause I do not have another computer to test to

However the original one doesnt have backlight and image
this BRAND NEW doesnt have backlight

What options do I have?

Buy another one? LOL  I am out of money I bought this one after coming here asking for solution

To really test with a KIND OF KNOW GOOD since its a new one

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
Known good no need to be perfect.
Keep damaged screens for test in service.
Broken screen, but which you know got backlight before replaced is perfect for test.
The problem is to mark the compatible year on the broken test screens; once you remove from the machine.

Do you actually get any voltage at pin 1/J8300?
BKLT_EN_R is present?

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
I do not have any broken screen for this model to keep and test. I usually keep broken stuff if is TESTABLE.

PIN 1 J8300 = 0V
BKLT-EN_R = I measured on a TP on the side of the board, since the components are on the back of the board and not possible to measure without dissamble it. I hope this TP is related to the backlight

If you see the picture of the board its the only one that appears below L7720 and it gives me 4.50V

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message: [ATTACH type="full"]60903[/ATTACH]

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
Please, a bit of imagination.
Who impede you to connect the screen to the board out of shell?
You don't need to connect anything else; no TP, nor SSD.

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message: Why would I do everything without the shell if I can do it in the fastest way?

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
if the TP is the right one.

DONE

I am not sure since on the board view it appears a lot, but you are the MASTER here!

If this TP is not the right one, OK I will dissamble the board!

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
You may need to check more points on the backlight circuit.
Some of them will be available ONLY on the other side.

The boardview shows many more test points in that area; not seen on your picture.
Are you sure that is BKLT_EN_R and not BKLT_SDA???

"Fastest way" will be to test with known good compatible screen.
You may waste time with a good working board in fact.
Try to find 13" 2015 broken screen (with good backlight) in other service center, or second hand auction websites.
Is good to have it in stock for future repairs.

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
The boardview shows many more test points in that area; not seen on your picture.
Are you sure that is BKLT_EN_R and not BKLT_SDA??? 

 I AM NOT SURE... That's why I ask the MASTER!

I do not have a way to buy GOOD KNOWN WORKING SCREEN

I spend A LOT of money on a new one, brand new, which I guess its 100% working 
A1502 2015 BRAND NEW SCREEN

I will dissamble the board and give you the measurements that you requested... Any other measurement that you are looking?

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
"I AM NOT SURE... That's why I ask the MASTER!"
Do you expect that I will get 4924 board and confirm in continuity mode what test point is?
Why don't do it yourself?

"Any other measurement that you are looking?"
Post BKLT_EN_R first.

"I do not have a way to buy GOOD KNOWN WORKING SCREEN"
I mentioned broken screen, but with working backlight.

BTW, where did you buy the new 2015 screen?

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
Just found out that below U7700 had corrosion and PIN 1 was damaged 

Make a jumper and put back the same IC still the same behavior

Can I use a LP8561B0SQ from an iMac board 820-4668?

I think its the closest one I have here and I do have some A1278/A1466 donor boards.

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message: BKLT_EN_R = 3.32v

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message: You can find the backlight chip on A1398 and newer machines, 2016-2019.

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
I replaced with a backlight chip from a A1398 820-3787 donor board but still no backlight.


BKLT_EN_R = 3.32v 


What now?

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
Check all resistors and traces around U7700.
Post voltage for pins 5, 18, 11, 15, 16.
You may try changing Q7701.
Be sure D7710 is not shorted A-K.

Remember, check voltages with LCD connected.

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
F7700 does not have continuity can I replace it with a fuse from a A1278 donor board? 

The funny thing is if its a backlight issue as we checked and saw it with the brand new screen that I bought

WHY with the original screen it doesnt give image and I am not able to check with a flash light as it happens with the BRAND NEW screen?

Really weird!

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
You can replace the fuse with 3A fuse, or just a tiny wire (0.1mm).
Be sure first no short, or wrong resistance to ground on any pin of D7710.

Maybe original screen has image problem; or not easy to detect with flashlight.

threads.title: MBP A1502 no image on screen
threads.message:
Replace fuse and with original screen nothing happened.

With the brand new screen that you were think was not working

ITS 100% FINE

Weird situation to have backlight and screen damaged, right?
